title: Mobile-Friendly Task Manager App

requirements.text: Create a mobile-first task manager UI that works well on phone screens, including an accessible layout with a bottom navigation (or equivalent compact navigation) and touch-friendly controls.

quotes: I need a task manager app that works on phone with good user interface

acceptanceCriteria: Primary screens are usable on common mobile widths (e.g., ~360px) without horizontal scrolling.
Interactive elements (buttons, inputs, list items) are touch-friendly and have clear hover/active/focus states.
App layout remains usable on larger screens (tablet/desktop) via responsive design.

requirements.text: Implement core task CRUD features: create tasks, view task list, view task details, edit tasks, and delete tasks.

quotes: I need a task manager app that works on phone with good user interface

acceptanceCriteria: Users can add a task with at least: title (required), optional description.
Users can edit an existing task and see changes reflected immediately in the list.
Users can delete a task and it is removed from the list after confirmation.
A task details view (or expandable row) shows the full task information.

requirements.text: Add task organization and productivity controls: task completion toggle, basic filtering (All / Active / Completed), and sorting (e.g., newest first, or by due date if present).

quotes: I need a task manager app that works on phone with good user interface

acceptanceCriteria: Each task can be marked completed/uncompleted.
Users can filter the list by All, Active, Completed.
Users can change the sort order and the list updates accordingly.

requirements.text: Persist tasks in the Motoko backend so that tasks remain available after page refresh and canister upgrade safe handling is considered (use stable storage patterns as needed).

quotes: I need a task manager app that works on phone with good user interface

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes clear methods for listing, creating, updating, and deleting tasks.
State is stored in a way that is compatible with canister upgrades (stable variables / stable data approach).

requirements.text: Provide a polished, coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a modern mobile task manager, and apply it consistently across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent design system is evident across list items, forms, headers, and navigation.
Typography and spacing improve readability on small screens.
Do not use a blue+purple theme unless explicitly required by the user.

requirements.text: Generate and include custom static images used by the UI (stored under frontend/public/assets/generated) and render them in the app where appropriate (e.g., app icon, empty state).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are saved under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
At least one empty-state visual is shown when there are no tasks.
An app icon is included and used in the UI (e.g., header/favicon usage as feasible within the template).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths; compose them instead.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Push notifications, SMS, or email reminders.

required: Minimal task checklist app icon, flat illustration (app-icon.dim_512x512.png)
Empty state illustration showing an empty task list on a phone screen, clean modern style (empty-state-tasks.dim_1200x800.png)
